It is characterized by its thin, elongated leaves that are typically flat and smooth, with a dark green coloration. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Radiogrammitis plana has a simple structure with no true roots, stems, or vascular tissue, relying on spores for reproduction. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it an important component of pioneer vegetation in disturbed habitats.
